name: kafka_high_producer_latency_on_broker
description: This incident type typically involves a high producer latency on a broker in a Kafka environment. This can result in various potential impacts, such as client timeouts, delays in processing workload, or a lack of capacity leading to performance issues. Recommended actions typically include investigating the state of the broker, rebalancing topics, expanding capacity, or restarting/replacing the broker. Monitoring tools may trigger alerts to notify engineers of this potential issue.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Kafka high producer latency on broker.
This incident type typically involves a high producer latency on a broker in a Kafka environment. This can result in various potential impacts, such as client timeouts, delays in processing workload, or a lack of capacity leading to performance issues. Recommended actions typically include investigating the state of the broker, rebalancing topics, expanding capacity, or restarting/replacing the broker. Monitoring tools may trigger alerts to notify engineers of this potential issue.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check if Kafka is running on the broker

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `systemctl status kafka`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check if there are any issues with the Kafka process

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `journalctl -u kafka  --since "2 hours ago"`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the disk usage on the broker

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `df -h`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the network connections on the broker

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `netstat -an | grep ${BROKER_IP}`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check the number of connections to the broker

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `netstat -an | grep ${BROKER_IP} | wc -l`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the number of messages in the topic

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-run-class kafka.tools.GetOffsetShell --broker-list ${BROKER_IP}:${BROKER_PORT} --topic ${TOPIC_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the number of partitions in the topic

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `kafka-topics --zookeeper ${ZOOKEEPER_IP}:${ZOOKEEPER_PORT} --describe --topic ${TOPIC_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the resource utilization of the broker

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `top`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check the Kafka log file for errors

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `tail -f /var/log/kafka/kafka.log`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## High network latency can cause producer latency on Kafka brokers.

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_kafka_latency_test()

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Tune Kafka configuration parameters, such as the producer batch size and the number of acknowledgments required, to optimize performance.

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_update_kafka_config($NEW_BATCH_SIZE, $NEW_NUMBER_OF_ACKNOWLEDGMENTS, $PATH_TO_KAFKA_CONFIG_FILE)
